ihs.apcs.spacebattle

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • ihs.apcs.spacebattle.Point

  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a point in space as an (x, y) coordinate.
    Since:
    0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new point from an array.

      Creates a new point with the given coordinates.

      • Point

        public Point(double x,
     double y)
        Creates a new point with the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate
        y - the y-coordinate

      • Point

        public Point(double[] coords)
        Creates a new point from an array. The first element of the array is considered to be the x-coordinate and the second element is the y-coordinate.
        Parameters:
        coords - the coordinates of the point

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceTo

        public double getDistanceTo(Point other)
        Gets the distance from this to another Point in space using the standard distance formula.
        Parameters:
        other - the location to which to calculate the distance
        Returns:
        the distance between this point and other

      • getAngleTo

        public int getAngleTo(Point other)
        Gets the absolute angle between this and another Point in space. More specifically, calculates the counter-clockwise angle from due east (0 degrees) to a line containing both this and other.

        To determine the amount of rotation necessary to face the argument, a ship's current orientation should be subtracted from the result of this method.

        Parameters:
        other - the location to which to calculate the angle
        Returns:
        the absolute angle from this to other

      • getPointAt

        public Point getPointAt(double angle,
               double distance)
        Returns a new point which represents the location at the given angle and distance away from this point.
        Parameters:
        angle - from due east (0 degrees)
        distance - from this point
        Returns:
        a new Point the given angle/distance away from this point
        Since:
        1.2

      • isInEllipse

        public boolean isInEllipse(Point center,
                  int major,
                  int minor,
                  int orientation)
        Checks if this point is in an Ellipse with the given center point, major/minor axis lengths at the given orientation.
        Parameters:
        center - of the ellipse
        major - axis length
        minor - axis length
        orientation - angle of the major axis
        Returns:
        true if this point is within the specified ellipse
        Since:
        1.2

      • getClosestMappedPoint

        public Point getClosestMappedPoint(Point other,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Maps the other point across world boundaries to return the closest form of the given point. Note: This point may map outside the bounds of the world, it should only be used for orientation purposes and distance only.
        Parameters:
        other - point to map from this one
        width - of the world
        height - of the world
        Returns:
        form of the point that is closest to this one
        Since:
        1.2

      • isCloseTo

        public boolean isCloseTo(Point other,
                double tolerance)
        Returns true if the given point's X & Y values are within the tolerance of this point's X & Y values. This is a 'box' test.
        Parameters:
        other - location to test against
        tolerance - amount to test in range against
        Returns:
        true if the points are close to one another.
        Since:
        1.2
